content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Intended Lab for Research at Position (0.5, 2.5)
Intended to receive Automation Science Packs needed for research. Multiple attempts were made to craft and place this Lab, but none succeeded due to inventory shortages and missing sub-ingredients.

### Utilized Smelting Furnaces (Existing Infrastructure)
• Iron Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)  
  Used to smelt iron ore into iron plates for subsequent production of Lab subcomponents.
• Copper Furnace at Position (–27.0, –60.0)  
  Used to smelt copper ore into copper plates as part of the resource recovery for Lab crafting.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• API Call Misuse – get_entities  
  – When calling get_entities, using an unexpected keyword (e.g. “radius”) or supplying positional arguments led to TypeErrors.  
  – Tip: Verify the function’s signature and call it with the correct parameters.

• Handling Missing Entity Lists  
  – Filtering operations on a None value (when get_entities returns None) caused a “NoneType object is not iterable” error.  
  – Tip: Use a fallback (such as an empty list) when no entities are returned.

• Lab Placement and Inventory Issues  
  – Attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) repeatedly failed because no Lab was available in the inventory.  
  – Tip: Confirm that the required building is present in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Insufficient Resources for Lab Crafting  
  – Crafting errors cited missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) needed for Lab production.  
  – Tip: Ensure the production chain for subcomponents is fully supported (including sufficient smelting and precursor production) before reattempting Lab crafting.
